body:
### Problem:
":restart" always executes ":qall" on the server in order to exit it. 
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/33953#discussion_r2119590367

### Solution:
Add an arg to ":restart" as ":restart +cmd" to control how the server exits.

comment_data.body: also need to handle the case where the +cmd didnt cause an exit nor an error ?

If +cmd doesn't error and doesn't quit the server we are at a state where the UI has attached to the newly created server and the "dangling" server is at the end of the if-else block. We could just call `getout(0)` if we get there by logging an error message (would just need to remove the else, the log can go after this error check).

> We could just call `getout(0)` if we get there by logging an error message

logging *and* then call `getout` makes sense 👍

~A small problem with this: ":restart +qall" still triggers `getout(0)` from within `ex_quitall_or_restart` (renamed to `ex_restart` as per https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/34788#issuecomment-3043318938 ). I check for the `exiting` global being `false` before triggering it and it doesn't seem to be set quick enough.~

~ref: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/34788/files#diff-e8cf5e56e29738d0c1605f75d1b158ea0fae543b45c55e3b721f91dd10ac9b49R4869~

Resolved: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/34788/commits/0856ee4d700a96e67f80ff0e740c4316c45a9c16

If you have this check here, doesn't this essentially make it pointless to support `:restart +qall!`?

On the other hand, if you remove this check, even `:restart +echo` will quit the server without confirmation, as you still call `getout(0)` anyway.

> On the other hand, if you remave this check, even `:restart +echo` will quit the server without confirmation, as you still call `getout(0)` anyway.

This is true. We would need to somehow check if ":cmd" would quit the server and only then call `remote_ui_restart` (because we don't need to attach to the new server unless we know the old server will exit). If it doesn't quit the server, we could maybe just `emsg` the log and bail on restarting altogether..

The first part of this is what I'd need to figure out. Any suggestions? I was initially thinking to just match against a list of possible "quit" commands (and combinations) and then checking against that. But that's probably not efficient.
Resolved: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/34788/commits/60eeaa92afbd09c4fbe428b822edff22e0aedd9e

> I was initially thinking to just match against a list of possible "quit" commands (and combinations) and then checking against that

That's probably good enough for now.

The "right" way to do things is probably to setup some sort of `on_exiting` callback which performs `remote_ui_restart` only when Nvim is about to exit, wherever the `VimLeavePre` logic is.
does the `This fails when changes have been made` note need to be updated? Also should mention `:confirm restart` as a hint.

comment_data.body: Also added a check to see if the "+cmd" itself ends with a bang (!). If so, ":restart +qall!" also supports force restart as well as ":confirm restart" as we still do the `check_changed_any` check.

Running ":confirm restart" when not checking for changes by default in `ex_restart` runs ":qall" on the old server. This would still check for changes and the old server would never exit because of that.

comment_regular_data.body:
~I would need to look at these failing tests a little bit more...~

Only needed a rebase :D

Thanks @sathya-pramodh ! This also means the current "!" behavior can be removed (we can decide what "!" means later). Do you plan to add a test? 

Maybe as a followup, I think it's clear now that we also need to support arbitrary commands, like `:restart lua vim.pack.update()` #34822 .

The current implementation of this PR calls `getout(0)` even if the `+cmd` doesn't exit the server. To remove `!`, this behavior needs to be removed.

Also, is be a problem that `ExitPre` may be triggered multiple times due to `+cmd`.

> This also means the current "!" behavior can be removed (we can decide what "!" means later). 

Yes! That should be easy :)

> Do you plan to add a test? 

Yeah. I could just make two test cases: one where +cmd exits the server and one where +cmd doesn't. Shouldn't be an issue, and if ":restart!" is removed then I'd need to call ":confirm restart" or ":restart +qall!" instead (former preferably).

> The current implementation of this PR calls `getout(0)` even if the `+cmd` doesn't exit the server. To remove `!`, this behavior needs to be removed.

Wait isn't it only executed if the command's cmdidx is not `CMD_restart`?

> Also, is be a problem that `ExitPre` may be triggered multiple times due to `+cmd`.

I didn't think of that, that's a good catch. I'll have to look into this. Maybe a global state for all commands to see if the caller wants hooks to trigger? Or we could just move `before_quit_all()` into the branch that triggers the `getout(0)` for ":qall"....

> Wait isn't it only executed if the command's cmdidx is not `CMD_restart`?

Oops, I misread the code.

> Or we could just move `before_quit_all()` into the branch that triggers the `getout(0)` for ":qall"....

Honestly think this is a much better option.
Then it's better to move `:restart` and `:qall` to two separate functions.
Yep. That'd be a very easy change as well :)

I don't think the current state of this PR is useful. It is quite limited and confusing due to this:
> just match against a list of possible "quit" commands (and combinations) and then checking against that

To be useful, it's better to achieve this:
> setup some sort of on_exiting callback which performs `remote_ui_restart` only when Nvim is about to exit

> To be useful, it's better to achieve this:
> 
> > setup some sort of on_exiting callback which performs `remote_ui_restart` only when Nvim is about to exit

Would it make sense if we add a new global `restarting` which is set by calls to `ex_restart` and then we check that to call `remote_ui_restart` before running the VimExitPre hooks?
Oops. I meant VimLeavePre sorry.. `EVENT_EXITPRE` in the `auto_event` enum to be specific. Triggered here: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/src/nvim/ex_docmd.c#L4718

It should definitely not be sent before `ExitPre`, as `ExitPre` autocommands may prevent exiting. I wonder if it should be sent after all autocommands, e.g. in `os_exit()`, which is the common exit path.
